intro: Castilleja applegatei var. fragilis, commonly known as Applegate's paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with elongated bracts that resemble paintbrushes. It has a shallow root system and relies on host plants for some of its nutrients.
